intro: Psychotria comorensis, commonly known as the Comorian Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the Comoros Islands in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded forest environments. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
